intro: Hesperis linearifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved honesty, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and clusters of small, white or pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and blooms in late spring to early summer. Its flowers have a distinctive four-petaled structure, and the plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Hesperis linearifolia is also known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun conditions.
